text: [Charlie]: I've been tracking task progress, and I noticed Erin, Dave, and Alice were working in the Cafeteria, which seems like good coordination for staying safe.
[Erin]: Charlie, how can you "track task progress"?  There's no way to do that unless you are an impostor.
[Bob]: Erin is right, there's no task progress tracker, so how were you tracking it, Charlie?
[Alice]: Charlie, "tracking task progress" is impossible, so you're clearly lying and trying to mislead us.
[Charlie]: I misspoke earlier - I meant I was observing people in the Cafeteria and noticed they seemed to be working on tasks, like helping each other out and moving around the room.
[Erin]: Charlie, observing people "moving around the room" isn't the same as "tracking task progress," so which is it?
[Bob]: Charlie, you first said you were "tracking task progress," then "observing," and now you're talking about "helping each other out" – which story is it?
[Alice]: Charlie, your constantly shifting explanations only confirm my suspicion that you're the impostor, and I'm voting to eject you.

[Charlie]: I realize my previous statements have been inconsistent and raised suspicion, so I'll directly address the concerns: Alice seems very eager to vote me out, and I want to know why she's pushing so hard to eject me without hearing me out completely.
[Erin]: Charlie, stop deflecting and explain how you were "tracking task progress" – it's a clear lie, and I'm still voting to eject you.
[Bob]: Charlie, you claimed to be "tracking task progress," which is impossible, then changed your story multiple times – I saw you vent in Medbay, so I'm voting to eject you.
[Alice]: Bob, I saw you, Charlie, and myself in Medbay, and since you confirmed seeing him vent, everyone please vote to eject Charlie.

[Charlie]: Bob claims he saw me vent in Medbay, but I challenge him to provide precise details about the exact moment and manner of this alleged venting, while also pointing out that Alice seems unusually eager to eject me without giving me a fair chance to explain, which makes her behavior seem suspiciously coordinated.
[Erin]: Charlie, your attempts to deflect blame onto Alice won't work – Bob saw you vent, and we're voting you out.
[Bob]: Alice, thank you for corroborating my report about Charlie venting in Medbay; please everyone vote to eject Charlie now.
[Alice]: Bob and I both saw Charlie vent in Medbay, so vote to eject him now.

[Charlie]: I challenge Bob's claim about seeing me vent by demanding specific, verifiable details, while simultaneously highlighting the suspiciously synchronized accusations from Bob and Alice, which suggests they might be working together to misdirect the group's attention.
[Erin]: Charlie,  Bob saw you vent, Alice corroborated, and your "task progress" lie is proof enough; we're voting you out.
[Bob]: Charlie's evasiveness and contradictory statements, combined with Alice's and my eyewitness account of him venting in Medbay, are enough evidence to vote him out.
[Alice]: Charlie's desperate attempts to deflect and discredit Bob and me won't work – we both saw him vent in Medbay, so vote him out.
